org.cloudifysource.dsl
Class Service

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.dsl.Service

public class Service
extends Object

The POJO for a service running in Cloudify. All of the details required to run a specific service are available here. This is the main configuration object used by the USM to install, run, monitor and stop a process.

Since:
1.0.0
Author:
barakme

getScaleOutCooldownInSeconds

public long getScaleOutCooldownInSeconds()

setScaleOutCooldownInSeconds

public void setScaleOutCooldownInSeconds(long scaleOutCooldownInSeconds)
Parameters:
scaleOutCooldownInSeconds - - The time (in seconds) that scaling rules are disabled after scale out (instances added)
See Also:
setScaleOutCooldownInSeconds(long), setScaleCooldownInSeconds(long)

getScaleInCooldownInSeconds

public long getScaleInCooldownInSeconds()

setScaleInCooldownInSeconds

public void setScaleInCooldownInSeconds(long scaleInCooldownInSeconds)
Parameters:
scaleInCooldownInSeconds - - The time (in seconds) that scaling rules are disabled after scale in (instances removed)
See Also:
setScaleCooldownInSeconds(long), setScaleOutCooldownInSeconds(long)

setScaleCooldownInSeconds

public void setScaleCooldownInSeconds(long scaleCooldownInSeconds)
Parameters:
scaleCooldownInSeconds - - The time (in seconds) that scaling rules are disabled after scale in (instances removed) or scale out (instances added) This has the same effect as calling setScaleInCooldownInSeconds(long) and setScaleOutCooldownInSeconds(long) separately.
See Also:
setScaleInCooldownInSeconds(long), setScaleOutCooldownInSeconds(long)

getScaleCooldownInSeconds

public long getScaleCooldownInSeconds()
Returns:
the time in seconds that scaling rules are disabled after scale in or scale out. In case the scale in and scale out values are different it returns the bigger value.
